item.title: Compositional Time Series
item.description:
We are developing statitistical and computational methods to analyze high-dimensional time series data, motivated in particular by ecological communities.

Much of this work is done in collaboration with the Weecology Lab.

item.title: Ecological Forecasting
item.description:
We are applying cutting-edge computational tools to automate forecasting of ecological populations in realtime. In association, we are translating forecasting science from disparate domains to ecological settings in order to best leverage contemporary methods.

Much of this work is done in collaboration with the Weecology Lab.

item.title: Estimators for Ecological Processes in Applied Settings
item.description:
We develop computational and statistical tools for estimation of ecological processes (mortality, spawning, recruitment) from data collected by on-the-ground managers.

This work is done in collaboration with USGS, Bat Conservation International, Cramer Fish Sciences.

item.title: Loss & Salvage of Endangered Fish
item.description:
We are keenly interested in the dynamics of endangered fish in the California Delta, which can be studied through a variety of data sources.

In particular, we have developed a continuous pipeline to automatically analyze newly collected data and update a live website.
